name: Preethi Reddy
title: Senior Frontend Developer - Web Components & Modern UI Architecture
professional_summary: Possess 8 years of frontend development experience across Healthcare, Government, Banking, and Consulting domains, with strong focus on Web Components migration and modern component architecture patterns.

Transformed legacy ReactJS applications into scalable Web Components using Stencil.js, Shadow DOM, and Custom Elements API, establishing reusable component libraries that reduced development time across teams.

Applied TypeScript and JavaScript to build responsive, accessible user interfaces adhering to WCAG standards, ensuring cross-browser compatibility through polyfills and ES Modules for production-grade component delivery.

Migrated monolithic frontend systems to component-based architectures, documenting migration strategies, breaking changes, and versioning approaches while maintaining backward compatibility for existing consumers.
Integrated Model Context Protocol (MCP) with Node.js backend services to enable AI agent interoperability, preparing frontend systems for LLM-driven user interactions and autonomous agent workflows.

Configured build tooling with Vite and Webpack to bundle Stencil.js components, optimizing load times and implementing code splitting strategies that improved page performance metrics across healthcare applications.

Collaborated with architects and platform teams to design API contracts for stable component interfaces, ensuring seamless framework interoperability between ReactJS, Vue.js, and vanilla JavaScript implementations.

Debugged Shadow DOM encapsulation issues and CSS specificity conflicts during component library rollouts, resolving browser inconsistencies through targeted polyfills and progressive enhancement techniques.

Established documentation workflows using Storybook and MDX to create comprehensive migration guides, component API references, and usage examples that accelerated team onboarding and reduced support requests.

Conducted code reviews focusing on Web Components best practices, accessibility compliance, and performance optimization, mentoring junior developers on Custom Elements lifecycle hooks and reactive data patterns.

Assessed migration risks and effort estimations for converting 50-plus legacy components to Web Components, presenting technical roadmaps with phased rollout strategies to minimize production disruptions.

Validated component behavior through Jest unit tests and Playwright end-to-end testing, implementing Web Test Runner for cross-browser validation of Custom Elements in isolated Shadow DOM environments.

Monitored frontend performance using browser DevTools and Lighthouse audits, identifying rendering bottlenecks and implementing lazy loading patterns that reduced initial bundle sizes for HIPAA-compliant patient portals.

Attended daily standups and sprint planning sessions to align component development priorities with product roadmaps, facilitating cross-team communication between frontend engineers and AI platform stakeholders.

responsibilities: Architected Web Components migration strategy for patient portal using Stencil.js and Custom Elements API, documenting breaking changes and effort estimates while ensuring HIPAA compliance for sensitive healthcare data displays.

Built reusable component library with Shadow DOM encapsulation and TypeScript interfaces, establishing API contracts that enabled ReactJS and Vue.js framework interoperability across multiple healthcare application teams.

Integrated Model Context Protocol (MCP) using Node.js backend connections to prepare UI for AI agent interactions, designing component interfaces that support future LLM-driven patient assistance workflows.

Configured Vite build tooling to bundle ES Modules and optimize component delivery, implementing code splitting that reduced initial load times for insurance eligibility verification screens by analyzing Lighthouse metrics.

Refactored legacy ReactJS forms into responsive Web Components with WCAG-compliant ARIA labels, resolving cross-browser rendering issues through targeted polyfills for older Internet Explorer versions still used in clinics.

Documented comprehensive migration guide using Storybook and MDX, detailing versioning strategy and backward compatibility approaches that allowed gradual component adoption without disrupting production member portals.

Troubleshot Shadow DOM CSS isolation conflicts during component rollout, debugging specificity issues in styled healthcare dashboards and implementing CSS custom properties for consistent theming across encapsulated components.

Wrote Jest unit tests and Playwright end-to-end scenarios for Custom Elements lifecycle hooks, validating Web Components behavior in isolated test environments using Web Test Runner to ensure quality standards.

Collaborated with architects on frontend framework migration roadmap, assessing risks for converting 60-plus legacy components while maintaining GDPR and FDA regulatory compliance for medical device software interfaces.

Reviewed pull requests focusing on Web Components best practices, mentoring team members on Shadow DOM patterns and Custom Elements API usage during pair programming sessions to maintain code quality consistency.

Attended sprint planning meetings to align component development with product priorities, facilitating discussions between frontend engineers and AI platform teams regarding future agent interoperability requirements.

Monitored production component performance through AWS CloudWatch and browser DevTools, identifying rendering bottlenecks in patient appointment scheduling interfaces and implementing lazy loading for improved responsiveness.

Updated design system documentation with new Web Components guidelines, creating usage examples and API references that reduced support tickets from consuming teams by providing clear implementation patterns.

Coordinated with QA team on accessibility testing protocols, ensuring all custom healthcare components met Section 508 requirements and WCAG standards through automated testing and manual screen reader validation.

Developed component architecture for government citizen portals using TypeScript and JavaScript, implementing Custom Elements patterns that prepared codebase for future Web Components migration aligned with state technology standards.

Constructed responsive UI components with HTML and CSS following WCAG accessibility guidelines, ensuring government service applications met Section 508 compliance requirements for public-facing digital services.

Implemented ReactJS component library with shared design tokens, establishing versioning strategy and backward compatibility protocols that allowed multiple state agency teams to consume components without breaking existing implementations.

Automated component testing workflows using Jest and Playwright, creating test suites that validated browser compatibility across Chrome, Firefox, and Safari to ensure consistent user experiences for diverse citizen populations.

Optimized frontend bundle sizes through Webpack configuration and ES Modules adoption, reducing load times for unemployment benefits application by analyzing performance metrics and implementing dynamic imports.

Participated in code review sessions with senior architects, discussing API contract design approaches and component interface stability patterns that later influenced department-wide frontend standardization initiatives.

Resolved CSS specificity conflicts in legacy AngularJS applications during gradual modernization effort, debugging styling inconsistencies while maintaining visual parity with existing government branding guidelines.

Organized technical documentation in MDX format detailing component usage patterns, creating internal guides that helped onboard new contract developers and reduced recurring questions in team communication channels.

Facilitated accessibility audits using screen readers and keyboard navigation testing, identifying ARIA label gaps in form components and remediated issues to ensure equitable access for citizens with disabilities.

Tracked frontend performance using browser DevTools and Google Cloud monitoring tools, investigating slow rendering in public assistance eligibility checkers and implementing caching strategies to improve response times.
Created online banking interface components using JavaScript and HTML, implementing responsive design patterns that adapted layouts for mobile and desktop users accessing account management features.
Enhanced ReactJS application performance by refactoring class components to functional components with hooks, reducing re-render cycles in transaction history views through memoization techniques.
Styled financial dashboard interfaces with CSS and Sass, maintaining brand consistency across customer-facing pages while adhering to banking accessibility standards for visually impaired users.
Tested UI components using Jest framework, writing unit tests for form validation logic and API integration points to catch bugs before deployment to production banking systems.
Debugged cross-browser JavaScript issues in Internet Explorer 11, implementing polyfills for Promise and Fetch APIs to ensure legacy browser support for customers unable to upgrade.
Contributed to design system documentation, recording component usage guidelines and coding standards that helped maintain consistency across multiple banking application development teams.
Assisted QA team in reproducing frontend defects, providing detailed technical context about component behavior and suggesting fixes during bug triage meetings to expedite resolution timelines.
Delivered responsive credit card application forms with TypeScript type safety, validating user inputs client-side to reduce server load and improve form submission success rates.
Produced interactive web pages using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript for consulting client projects, translating design mockups into functional user interfaces under senior developer guidance.
Modified existing AngularJS controllers and templates, fixing minor bugs and adding new features to enterprise applications based on client feedback collected during sprint review meetings.
Supported senior developers during code integration tasks, learning Git version control workflows and participating in merge conflict resolution when combining feature branches.
Executed manual browser testing across different devices, documenting UI inconsistencies in bug tracking system and verifying fixes implemented by team members before release.
Attended daily standup meetings and sprint retrospectives, learning agile development practices and gaining exposure to professional software development lifecycles in consulting environment.
Gained experience with responsive CSS techniques, adjusting media queries and flexbox layouts to ensure client websites displayed correctly on smartphones and tablets.
